<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.11, 0.01)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|4823|-1|porting notes|
|93|-1|disabled deprecation lints|
|3101|-5|total LoC in `Deprecated` files|

Current commit [bcc4b3c17f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/bcc4b3c17f6d59da278b6378cbfe15a23227d65b)
Reference commit [95cdc7a6ab](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/95cdc7a6aba073b8cca8ba8d806e352b4e8ca0e5)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

What's our strategy to avoid:
* Someone makes a PR that sits open for 9 months, with deprecations
* It finally gets merged
* Coincidentally, we immediately embark on a deprecation-cleaning pass
* Only after that cleaning concludes do we hit a v4.x.y tag

(Which is undesirable because downstream users hopping between major releases would never see the deprecation) 

Is the answer "ask to update the dates (if they're more than 2 months old) before merging in step 2"?

> Is the answer "ask to update the dates (if they're more than 2 months old) before merging in step 2"?

This seems reasonable.

(Also --- let's not have PRs that take 9 months to merge! :-)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12630653103/job/35190884190)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12630653103/job/35190884441)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: remove >9 month old deprecations

Current commit [bcc4b3c17f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/bcc4b3c17f6d59da278b6378cbfe15a23227d65b)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

What's our strategy to avoid:
* Someone makes a PR that sits open for 9 months, with deprecations
* It finally gets merged
* Coincidentally, we immediately embark on a deprecation-cleaning pass
* Only after that cleaning concludes do we hit a v4.x.y tag

(Which is undesirable because downstream users hopping between major releases would never see the deprecation) 

Is the answer "ask to update the dates (if they're more than 2 months old) before merging in step 2"?

> Is the answer "ask to update the dates (if they're more than 2 months old) before merging in step 2"?

This seems reasonable.

(Also --- let's not have PRs that take 9 months to merge! :-)
